DataElement.preferredName: Renal Carcinoma Renal Vein Microscopic Invasion Present Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator whether there is microscopic invasion of renal carcinoma, a malignant cells arising from the epithelium of the renal parenchyma (renal cell carcinoma) or the renal pelvis (renal pelvis carcinoma), in the one of the veins which return blood from the kidneys to the vena cava, being present.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Renal Carcinoma Renal Vein Microscopic Invasion Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to microscopic invasion of renal carcinoma, a carcinoma arising from the epithelium of the renal parenchyma (renal cell carcinoma) or the renal pelvis (renal pelvis carcinoma), in the one of the veins which return blood from the kidneys to the vena cava, being present.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from the epithelium of the renal parenchyma (renal cell carcinoma) or the renal pelvis (renal pelvis carcinoma).  The vast majority of renal cell carcinomas are adenocarcinomas.  The vast majority of renal pelvis carcinomas are transit

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from the epithelium of the renal parenchyma or the renal pelvis.  The majority are renal cell carcinomas.  Kidney carcinomas usually affect middle aged and elderly adults.  Hematuria, abdominal pain, and a palpable mass are common symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: The veins which return blood from the kidneys to the vena cava.:Microscopic; too small to be seen except under a microscope.:The movement of one cell type into an area normally occupied by a different cell type.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: The veins which return blood from the kidneys to the vena cava.
Too small to be seen except under a microscope.
The movement of one cell type into an area normally occupied by a different cell type.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.
